p:
Heat waves together with drought are likely to impact on higher trophic levels by disturbing natural enemy - host interactions and biological control efforts in agriculture. An increase in temperature combined with drought reduced parasitoid emergence from the cabbage aphid, Brevicoryne brassicae L.
41 . The reduced survival of nymphs in our study indicate that the decreased survival of parasitoids could be due to lower quality hosts as suggested by Romo and Tylianakis
41 .
